author: Salman Khan
title: Mike Jones to Helm Old Dominion Men's Basketball, Leaving Maryland Assistant Coach Position
text:
Mike Jones, previously an assistant coach for Maryland's men's basketball team, is set to become the head coach at Old Dominion University, his alma mater. This significant career move highlights Jones' return to a university where he had a distinguished playing career, leading the team to multiple NCAA Tournament appearances. His appointment follows the retirement of Jeff Jones, who stepped down after battling health issues.
From Player to Coach: Jones' Journey
Jones' basketball career has been marked by success both on and off the court. As a player for Old Dominion from 1991-1995, he scored over 1,000 points and was instrumental in leading the team to the NCAA Tournament. Post his playing career, Jones transitioned into coaching, leaving a lasting impact at DeMatha Catholic High School with a record of 511-19 over 19 seasons. His coaching prowess extended to the collegiate level at Virginia Tech and, most recently, Maryland, before accepting the head coaching position at Old Dominion.
A Legacy of Leadership
At Old Dominion, Jones steps into big shoes, replacing Jeff Jones, a seasoned coach who led the team for 11 years. Mike Jones brings a wealth of experience, including his time with USA Basketball, where he coached the U16 national team to a gold medal at the 2019 FIBA Americas U16 championships. His extensive background as both a player and coach at various levels of the game positions him as a strong candidate to guide Old Dominion's men's basketball team into its next chapter.
Implications for Old Dominion and Maryland
Mike Jones' departure from Maryland and subsequent arrival at Old Dominion is significant for both programs. For Old Dominion, Jones represents not only a return to a familiar face but also the promise of a new direction under his leadership. Maryland, on the other hand, faces the challenge of replacing a key figure in its coaching staff for the second season in a row. Jones' move underscores the dynamic nature of college basketball coaching, where shifts and changes can have a profound impact on a program's trajectory.
The appointment of Mike Jones as the head coach of Old Dominion's men's basketball team marks a pivotal moment for the university. With his deep connections to the school and a proven track record of success, Jones is poised to embark on a new journey that honors his past achievements while striving for future triumphs. As the college basketball world watches, Jones' tenure at Old Dominion will undoubtedly be a testament to his enduring commitment to excellence in the sport.
